scenarios.intro: You just lost 3 buy-ins to coolers in the last hour. Your opponent just 4-bet shoved with 72o and hit a full house.
scenarios.situation_context: Session: -5 buy-ins | Time at table: 4 hours | Your image: Tight

choices.label: Express Frustration
choices.description: Type something in chat about their play

choices.label: Take a Deep Breath
choices.description: Pause, breathe, and refocus on the next hand

choices.label: Leave the Table
choices.description: Take a break to clear your head

choices.label: Move Up Stakes
choices.description: Play higher to win it back faster

scenarios.explanation: After a cooler, the best response is to take a breath and refocus. Expressing frustration gives opponents information, leaving might be premature, and moving up stakes while tilted is the worst poker decision you can make.
scenarios.emotional_lesson: Coolers happen to everyone. Your response to variance determines your long-term success, not the cooler itself.

scenarios.intro: You've been card dead for 2 hours. Finally you pick up AA, but get cracked by 96s who flopped two pair.
scenarios.situation_context: Session: -2 buy-ins | Table image: Nitty | Last 50 hands: 0 VPIP

choices.label: Start Playing More Hands
choices.description: Loosen up to make up for being card dead

choices.label: Maintain Your Strategy
choices.description: Stick to your ranges and wait for good spots

choices.label: Quit for the Day
choices.description: The deck is against you today

choices.label: Target That Player
choices.description: Focus on getting your chips back from them

scenarios.explanation: Being card dead doesn't change math. Your ranges are still +EV. Loosening up or targeting specific players are emotional, not strategic decisions.
scenarios.emotional_lesson: Variance is a feature, not a bug. Trust your strategy even when results are bad.

scenarios.intro: You made a hero call with bottom pair and were right! But the river gave villain a runner-runner flush.
scenarios.situation_context: Pot: 200BB | Your read was perfect | Villain: Recreational player

choices.label: Show Your Hand
choices.description: Let them see the read was perfect

choices.label: Comment on Their Play
choices.description: They need to know that was a bad call

choices.label: Take a Short Break
choices.description: Walk it off before the next hand

scenarios.explanation: Your process was perfect. That's all you can control. Showing, berating, or leaving all focus on the result instead of the decision.
scenarios.emotional_lesson: Process over results. You want players to make these calls against you - they'll lose in the long run.
